avalancheActivity.comment:
Fresh wind slabs require caution. Individual avalanche prone locations are to be found in particular adjacent to ridgelines and in gullies and bowls, especially at high altitude. Even a small avalanche can sweep winter sport participants along and give rise to falls.
Only isolated gliding avalanches are possible. This applies in particular on steep grassy slopes below approximately 2200 m. Areas with glide cracks are to be avoided.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Conditions are favorable concerning avalanche hazard. There is a danger of falling on the hard crust.

snowpackStructure.comment:
Some snow has fallen in some localities. The wind will be moderate to strong at times over a wide area.
The old snowpack is moist and its surface has a strong melt-freeze crust. The snowpack will be stable.

tendency.comment: The avalanche danger will persist. Some snow will fall in some localities.
